fields.name: subjectkey
fields.description: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject

fields.name: src_subject_id
fields.description: Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project

fields.name: interview_date
fields.description: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

fields.name: interview_age
fields.description: Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
fields.notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

fields.name: fidsrs01
fields.notes: 0= Absent; 1= Mild (Expresses some sadness or discouragement on questioning); 2= Moderate (Distinct depressed mood persisting up to half the time over the last 2 weeks, present daily); 3= Severe (Markedly depressed mood persisting daily over half the time interfering with normal motor and social functioning)

fields.name: fidsrs02
fields.notes: 0= Absent; 1= Mild (Has at times felt hopeless over the last 2 weeks but still has some degree of hope for the future); 2= Moderate (Persistent; moderate sense of hopelessness over the last week. Can be persuaded to acknowledge possibility of things being better); 3= Severe (Persisting and distressing sense of hopelessness)

fields.name: fidsrs03
fields.notes: 0= Absent; 1= Mild (Frequent thoughts of being better off dead or occassional thoughts of suicide); 2= Moderate (Deliberately considered suicide with a plan but made no attempt); 3= Severe (Suicide attempt apparently designed to end in death [i.e. accidental discovery or inefficient means])

fields.name: fidsrs04
fields.notes: 0= Absent; 1= Mild (Participant appears sad and mournful during parts of the interview involving affectively neutral discussion.); 2= Moderate (Participant appears sad and mournful throughout the interview with gloomy monotonous voice and is tearful or close to tears at times.); 3= Severe (Participant chokes on distressing topics, frequently sighs deeply and cries openly, or is persistently in a state of frozen misery if you are sure this is present.)

fields.name: fidsrs06
fields.notes: 1= Participant; 2= Parents/relatives; 3= Mental health professionals; 4= Chart

fields.name: fidsrs07
fields.description: Reason for questionable validity of assessment
fields.notes: 1= Symptoms possibly drug-induced; 2= Participant uncooperative; 3= Underrated due to lack of rapport; 4= Difficult to assess due to formal thought disorder; 5= Underreported due to negative symptoms; 6= Other
